headline.main: BESIEGED CAPUZZO IS BATTERED DAILY; But the British Stop for Tea When Mirages Appear and Blot Out Italian Fort 'MINIATURE' WAR DEADLY Water Is as Vital as Powder in Desert Battling--Post Has Been Reinforced

lead_paragraph: WITH THE BRITISH FORCES, On the Egyptian-Libyan Border, Aug. 1--Almost literally sitting on the barbed-wire fence that forms the border between the British and Italian forces, your correspondent is writing this dispatch as the British artillery in the background pastes hell out of the Italians in the most northern and most important Port, Capuzzo.
